resources.string: Orbital inclination measures the tilt of an object\'s orbit around a celestial body. It is expressed as the angle between a reference plane and the orbital plane or axis of direction of the orbiting object.
When angle of inclination is 0 degree or when the planet is in direct line of sight of the observer then it is called edge-on position
When angle of inclination is 90 degree or when the planet is perpendicular to line of sight of the observer then it is called face-on position

So when the planet is in face-on position then we only know little about mass of the planet and thus it is considered that some planets discovered with spectroscopy might be too massive to be true planets.
A rogue planet also termed free-floating is a planetary-mass object that orbits a galactic center directly.
Yes Life might be possible on such a planet until it not crashes into some other heavenly body.
1. We need energy resource like sun and as such planet is way away from that star\'s resource, so it completely depends on heat from it\'s core if it\'s still ignited.
2.If we are able to found such a high energy core then we have to look for trapping of that heat.

3.There might be insulation from a icesheet covering the planet but it should be at least 10 km thick or it must have a thick atmosphere(better option) but it needs to 10 to 100 times thicker for trapping the required energy for life.
4.If heat is trapped then conversion from it to food will be of very low efficiency. eg. chemoautotrophs
